verses.verse: Wisdom <S%H2454><s%> hath built <S%H1129><s%> her house, <S%H1004><s%> she hath hewn out <S%H2672><s%> her seven <S%H7651><s%> pillars: <S%H5982><s%>
She hath killed <S%H2873><s%> her beasts; <S%H2874><s%> she hath mingled <S%H4537><s%> her wine; <S%H3196><s%> she hath also <S%H637><s%> furnished <S%H6186><s%> her table. <S%H7979><s%>
She hath sent forth <S%H7971><s%> her maidens: <S%H5291><s%> she crieth <S%H7121><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> the highest places <S%H1610><s%> <S%H4791><s%> of the city, <S%H7176><s%>
Whoso <S%H4310><s%> is simple, <S%H6612><s%> let him turn <S%H5493><s%> in hither: <S%H2008><s%> as for him that wanteth <S%H2638><s%> understanding, <S%H3820><s%> she saith <S%H559><s%> to him,
Come, <S%H1980><s%> eat <S%H3898><s%> of my bread, <S%H3899><s%> and drink <S%H8354><s%> of the wine <S%H3196><s%> which I have mingled. <S%H4537><s%>
Forsake <S%H5800><s%> the foolish, <S%H6612><s%> and live; <S%H2421><s%> and go <S%H833><s%> in the way <S%H1870><s%> of understanding. <S%H998><s%>

He that reproveth <S%H3256><s%> a scorner <S%H3887><s%> getteth <S%H3947><s%> to himself shame: <S%H7036><s%> and he that rebuketh <S%H3198><s%> a wicked <S%H7563><s%> man getteth himself a blot. <S%H3971><s%>
Reprove <S%H3198><s%> not <S%H408><s%> a scorner, <S%H3887><s%> lest <S%H6435><s%> he hate <S%H8130><s%> thee: rebuke <S%H3198><s%> a wise man, <S%H2450><s%> and he will love <S%H157><s%> thee.

Give <S%H5414><s%> instruction to a wise <S%H2450><s%> man, and he will be yet <S%H5750><s%> wiser: <S%H2449><s%> teach <S%H3045><s%> a just <S%H6662><s%> man, and he will increase <S%H3254><s%> in learning. <S%H3948><s%>
The fear <S%H3374><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%> is the beginning <S%H8462><s%> of wisdom: <S%H2451><s%> and the knowledge <S%H1847><s%> of the holy <S%H6918><s%> is understanding. <S%H998><s%>
For <S%H3588><s%> by me thy days <S%H3117><s%> shall be multiplied, <S%H7235><s%> and the years <S%H8141><s%> of thy life <S%H2416><s%> shall be increased. <S%H3254><s%>
If <S%H518><s%> thou be wise, <S%H2449><s%> thou shalt be wise <S%H2449><s%> for thyself: but if thou scornest, <S%H3887><s%> thou alone <S%H905><s%> shalt bear <S%H5375><s%> it.
A foolish <S%H3687><s%> woman <S%H802><s%> is clamorous: <S%H1993><s%> she is simple, <S%H6615><s%> and knoweth <S%H3045><s%> nothing. <S%H1077><s%> <S%H4100><s%>
For she sitteth <S%H3427><s%> at the door <S%H6607><s%> of her house, <S%H1004><s%> on <S%H5921><s%> a seat <S%H3678><s%> in the high places <S%H4791><s%> of the city, <S%H7176><s%>
To call <S%H7121><s%> passengers <S%H5674><s%> <S%H1870><s%> who go right <S%H3474><s%> on their ways: <S%H734><s%>
Whoso <S%H4310><s%> is simple, <S%H6612><s%> let him turn <S%H5493><s%> in hither: <S%H2008><s%> and as for him that wanteth <S%H2638><s%> understanding, <S%H3820><s%> she saith <S%H559><s%> to him,
Stolen <S%H1589><s%> waters <S%H4325><s%> are sweet, <S%H4985><s%> and bread <S%H3899><s%> eaten in secret <S%H5643><s%> is pleasant. <S%H5276><s%>

But he knoweth <S%H3045><s%> not <S%H3808><s%> that <S%H3588><s%> the dead <S%H7496><s%> are there; <S%H8033><s%> and that her guests <S%H7121><s%> are in the depths <S%H6011><s%> of hell. <S%H7585><s%>
